p: AMS may be one of the first signs of COVID-19 infection in individuals with dementia. In the majority of adult patients, respiratory distress is the most common presenting symptom. Waiting for patients to develop dyspnea and/or fever will delay treatment. Recognizing the COVID-19 infection early is especially important in the frail elderly, particularly for individuals in communal living facilities where isolating these patients can help limit the spread of the virus.
